devdoc.author: rashtrakoff
devdoc.custom:experimental: This is an experimental contract/library. Use at your own risk.
devdoc.details: Contains functions which help with Superfluid streams related calculations

calcShare(FlowData storage,address,uint2.details: Calculates LP token share of a user for a particular invested token

params._flowRate: Flow rate of a user's stream of underlying token
params._marketLastLentAt: Timestamp of market's latest deposit action
params._totalInvestedBefore: Total amount of tokens invested by a contract till user's last update of the stream
params._totalInvestedCurr: Total amount of tokens invested by a contract till the current market index
params._totalReceivedBefore: Total amount of LP tokens received till user's last update of the stream
params._totalReceivedCurr: Total amount of LP tokens received till the current market index
params._userFlow: Struct containing streamed token details of a user

returns._0: Amount representing the share of a user of LP tokens This function automatically adjusts amounts based on token decimals and is found to be a bit inaccurate when it comes to tokens with decimals less than 18 (ex: USDC and USDT). This behaviour is unavoidable.

calcUserInvestedAfterUpdate(FlowData sto.details: Calculated amount invested after updating his/her stream

params._flowRate: Flow rate of a user's stream of underlying token
params._marketLastLentAt: Timestamp of market's latest deposit action
params._userFlow: Struct containing streamed token details of a user

returns._0: User invested amount after updating a stream

calcUserUninvested(FlowData storage,uint.details: Calculates uninvested amount of a user

params._flowRate: Flow rate of a user's stream of underlying token
params._marketLastLentAt: Timestamp of market's latest deposit action
params._userFlow: Struct containing streamed token details of a user

decimalAdjust(uint256,uint256,bool).details: Adjusts amount according to decimals of a token

params._decimals: Decimals of the token to be used for adjustment
params._upScale: Indicates whether the amount needs to be scaled up or scaled down

getDecimals(address).details: Helper function to get decimals of a token

returns._0: number representing decimal precision of a token

devdoc.title: Superfluid helper library

getFlow(IConstantFlowAgreementV1,address.notice: Function to get the flow rate of a user
